title: BBC's top presenters 'could boycott World Cup after hooligans' machete threat against broadcaster'
text:
Sport BBC's top presenters 'could boycott World Cup after hooligans' machete threat against broadcaster' Spartak Moscow fans unfurled a banner on Saturday which contained the words 'Blah Blah Channel' and featured drawings of two masked hooligans, one holding a machete Share Staff at the BBC could boycott the World Cup due to safety fears (Photo: Mikhail Metzel\\TASS via Getty Images) Share Get   Thank you for subscribing!   
A number of the BBC's top presenters and pundits are reportedly considering boycotting next summer's World Cup over fears for their safety. 
The claim by the Daily Star comes after Spartak Moscow fans unfurled a banner on Saturday which contained the words 'Blah Blah Channel' and featured drawings of two masked hooligans, one holding a machete. 
The banner was reportedly made by supporters angered by a recent BBC documentary about hooliganism in Russia. 
Russia's Hooligan Army contained footage of yobs training to fight against rival fans at the 2018 tournament. 
Safety concerns have now forced some staff members to rethink whether or not they will travel east for next year's biggest sporting event. Spartak Moscow fans unfurled a threatening banner at a match on Saturday (Photo: Mikhail Metzel\\TASS via Getty Images) There are huge safety concerns ahead of next summer's tournament (Photo: Mikhail Metzel\\TASS via Getty Images) Hooliganism is a big issue in Russia (Photo: Mikhail Metzel\\TASS via Getty Images) 
BBC Radio 5 live commentator Alan Green last year confirmed he won't be going, while at least one other unnamed presenter has reportedly already decided against attending. 
A Daily Star source said: "It's just too much of a risk. After the organised violence orchestrated by the Russians at Euro 2016, the World Cup promises to be hell.
